title: Start Your Own Wholesale Distribution Business: Your Step-By-Step Guide to Success (StartUp Series)
features: You like doing deals and making money but don’t care much for the retail grind? You should be the middleman—the wholesaler—the one who buys goods in volume from manufacturers and sells them to retailers at a profit. With millions of products on the market already and new ones coming every day, the wholesale economy has plenty of room for growth. This guide reveals how to start a thriving wholesale operation, specializing in any industry you choose—and run it from your kitchen table, if you’d like. You’ll learn: • How to make contact with manufacturers and retailers • Which product lines will bring maximum success • Insider secrets for overcoming the competition • How to take advantage of the internet’s growing role in distribution • Effective strategies for increasing profit margins You’ll also get sample forms, step-by-step instructions, checklists and worksheets to guide you smoothly through each stage of the startup process. It’s a straight shot from where you are today to owning and running your own business—and you can start right now.
description: McGraw-Hill authors represent the leading experts in their fields and are dedicated to improving the lives, careers, and interests of readers worldwide

author: {'avatar': 'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/A1XHInLBiKL._SY600_.jpg', 'name': 'Bridget McCrea', 'about': ["An award-winning journalist and long-time ASJA member, Bridget McCrea has been writing for national business magazines since 1995. The author of six books, including The RE/MAX Home Buyer's Survival Guide and Second Homes for Dummies, Bridget's articles have been published in Fortune Small Business, International Business Times, Black Enterprise, Cancer Fighters Thrive, and REALTOR Magazine, among others. As a full-time freelance writer and CEO of Expert Writing Services, Inc., she prides herself in creating compelling content that readers can actually use and apply in their own lives -- both work and personal. A resident of Florida and proud mother of a soon-to-be Cal Poly SLO graduate, Bridget is a winning age group triathlete who enjoys sweating it out at hot yoga and traveling the world."]}
